results.title: LDTV
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: LDTV, refers to the artist’s term for ‘low definition television’. This work is a collection of television fragments videotaped directly from the TV screen in an array of countries in which Asher has travelled. On the one hand LDTV reflects the nomadic character of Asher’s work, but at the same time it reproduces the effect of a satellite fixed in space, giving unlimited access to a homogenised world. With vitality and humor, LDTV traces the speed at which Western culture is transmitted globally.

results.title: The Wolf
results.creator_credit: Beverly Bailey, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: It was Beverly Bailey’s husband who suggested she take the trip to England and Canada to meet his family. As Bailey disappeared through the airport door her husband wondered if he’d said the wrong thing.

results.title: A Memoir of the Bunurongs
results.brief_description: A brief memoir recording the sights, sounds and essence of Sorrento, a small seaside town nestled in between Portsea and Blairgowrie on the Mornington Peninsula. Evocative images are accompanied by a music soundtrack and text (in English).

results.title: ACMI Animation Open Studios: three weekends in September and October 2007
results.creator_credit: Jason White and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: Three animators - Dave Jones, Nick Hilligoss, Steve Piscopo - participated in three weekends over September and October 2007 in the ACMI Animation Open Studios (as part of Pixar) sharing their secrets with people of all ages. Using a combination of moving image, stills and animation to a music soundtrack, this is a record of what took place.
